publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3554 Helen Eadie: Congratulations to Remploy—That the Parliament congratulates Remploy on supporting 3,500 disabled people into employment in 2004-05, on its progressive approach to the learning and development of disabled people, on the access to learning provided by Remploy which offers disabled people more choice in their careers, on its work to provide a union learning representative in every factory and on the work of its recruitment division, Interwork, in supporting disabled people into mainstream employment; affirms a commitment to learning, equality of choice in employment and full social inclusion of disabled people, and calls on the Scottish Executive to explore with Remploy opportunities to employ increased numbers of disabled people. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*
